org.kaaproject.kaa.server.common.dao

Interface CredentialsService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InternalCredentialsService, TrustfulCredentialsService

    public interface CredentialsService
    A service to manage security credentials.

    In general, each application has its own independent credentials service used as a bridge to some external system. Since Kaa acts as such a system by default, a single credentials service is enough to be used across all applications. Its methods require an additonal parameter, though, namely the application ID.

    Since:
    v0.9.0
    Author:
    Andrew Shvayka, Bohdan Khablenko

      void markCredentialsRevoked(String applicationId, String credentialsId)
      Revokes the given credentials by setting their status to CredentialsStatus.REVOKED.

      Provides credentials information to the internal system.

      • markCredentialsInUse

        void markCredentialsInUse(String applicationId,
                          String credentialsId)
                   throws CredentialsServiceException
        Sets the status of the given credentials to CredentialsStatus.IN_USE.
        Parameters:
        applicationId - The application ID
        credentialsId - The credentials ID
        Throws:
        CredentialsServiceException - - if the credentials are not CredentialsStatus.AVAILABLE.
